column4: can some1 plz tell me how to install my 2 wire usb adapter on ubuntu
i plug it in the light dosn't turn on nothing is detected
ya i gotta go on xp untill i can get internet access
and i can't get internet access without my 2wire working..
any1 get 2wire to work on linux?
never heard of it
how would i install it on ubuntu  without an internet connection?
do you have an ubuntu installation CD, or access to the internet where you can make such a CD?
is the wireless card inside your computer provided by 2wire (the ISP) ?
you use a USB wireless network card, is that it?
ok gotcha, so do you know the model number of the usb wireless card?
the company that makes it and the model number
give us what you have
yes, there is a program called ndiswrapper
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
yes, it is. but you will need to have the windows driver files accessible
those should be downloadabale from 2wire
ok one second i made a mistake, ndiswrapper is NOT included by default

yes, a jump drive would work very well. all of the information is included in that document, so include that document on your jump drive. read through it carefully first to make sure you have downloaded all the files you will need before you reboot. And of course, good luck!
that is the theory
don't know anything about that, but i don't see why not
i wish you luck
